msgSnippet: Multithreading at the unit test level is a pain. Use the executor framework from java.util.concurrent to abstract the threads out of multithreaded or event
messageBody:
Multithreading at the unit test level is a pain. Use the executor framework from java.util.concurrent to abstract the threads out of multithreaded or event driven code. If you need a multithreaded test and you are usiong executors, maybe you can use the Future class somehow which allow tasks executed on a different thread to report exceptions.

Only make assertions in your main thread. Use Future or a BlockingQueue to send results back to your main thread before you assert your expectations.

Personally I always use Executors and a thread pool or single thread executor implementation. At test time a direct executor is used which just executes the task immediately so the test stays single threaded

- Neil
